news_header: Hamas delays hostage return, blaming Israel for treaty violations.
news_original_title: Hamas: Ensi lauantaina ei vapauteta panttivankeja
news_text: Hamas has announced a delay in the return of hostages scheduled for next Saturday, citing Israel's violations of the cease-fire agreement. Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz stated that Hamas's actions breach the cease-fire, and military preparations are underway. Prime Minister Netanyahu is holding security discussions, while brokers fear the ceasefire may collapse. Since the ceasefire on January 19, 16 Israeli hostages and 566 Palestinian prisoners have been released, with the first phase aiming to release 33 hostages and 1,900 Palestinians. Israel claims eight of the hostages are deceased.
